resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: [C++] CMake's find_package(Parquet) does not find Parquet with Arrow 3.0.0

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

kou commented on PR #13707:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13707#issuecomment-1197498104

   Could you show an error message without this change?

dg0yt commented on PR #13707:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13707#issuecomment-1197622790

   > Could you show an error message without this change?
   
   In other GH projects, I would have temporarily pushed a revert of the original change, and force-push without the revert after the CI run. (Or I would have pushed the test as first commit.) I can do that here, but I need maintainer approval for CI runs. 
   
   For reference, this is from vcpgk with the patch disactivated. Not a single static system lib passed in the linking step.
   ~~~

   TBH I don't really understand the issue title "arrow_static requires needless dependencies". The private dependencies are not "needless".
